courses: Thesis project: Empowering memories help maintain self-confidence in a stressful cognitive task
Relevant coursework: experimental psychology, psychopathology, personality, counseling, development, biopsychology, brain-mind-behavior seminar, data science in human neuroimaging

awards.title: Invitation to the 39th SNUCMAA of North America Convention
awards.awarder: Seoul National University College of Medicine Alumni Association of North America
awards.summary: Invited to present at the 39th Convention of the Seoul National University College of Medicine Alumni Association of North America, held in Falls Church, VA ($1,500 travel award).

awards.title: SNU Physician-Scientist Training Program Medical Student Research Scholarship
Premedical Student Research Award
awards.summary: Grand award (best presentation), awarded to 2 among 45 research participants in the premedical course, after oral presentation of selected abstracts ($1,000 scholarship). Displayed as an exemplary research output in the student orientation resources in 2023.

awards.title: Volunteer Social Service Award
awards.summary: Awarded to 5 among 142 participants in Volunteer Social Service, an elective volunteering program in Seoul National University.

awards.title: Talent Award of Korea
awards.awarder: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Education of the Republic of Korea
awards.summary: The national honor awarded to 50 South Korean high school students with outstanding academics, leadership, and community contribution ($2,000 scholarship).

awards.title: Korean Chemistry Olympiad Finalist: Certificate of Merit
awards.summary: Awarded to distinctive candidates among 27 finalists in Korean Chemistry Olympiad (KChO).

awards.title: Korean Biology Olympiad Finalist: Future Biologist Award
awards.awarder: The Korean Society of Biology Education
awards.summary: Awarded to 32 finalists in Korean Biology Olympiad (KBO).

volunteer.position: Mentoring Students to Envision Career and Life
highlights: Advised and supported 48 middle & high school students, focusing on career aspirations, life goals, and self-integrity.
In-depth sessions (2–3 hrs) to foster mentees' self-understanding and agency in school life alongside college application guidance.

volunteer.position: Cafeteria Server for the Equitable College Community, with Tenspoon
highlights: Worked weekly as a server in the college canteen, associated with Tenspoon (십시일밥 in Korean), an organization that provides meal vouchers to students from low-income families with wages earned by volunteer cafeteria workers.

volunteer.position: Leading a Psychology & Psychiatry Book Club for Teenagers
highlights: Hosted a book club for three teenage students on ˝Psychiatry for Teens (청소년을 위한 정신의학 에세이 in Korean)˝ by Jee Hyun Ha (Korean essay).
Introduced multimedia tools, e.g., essays and documentaries, as real-life examples of book chapters.
Discussion topics: the brain and mind, mental illness, psychology experiments (mentees shared their most intriguing ones), personalized care

volunteer.position: Learning Mentor for a Slow-Learner Student, with Peachmarket
highlights: Led weekly critical reading sessions for a middle school student, guided by Peachmarket (피치마켓 in Korean), an organization for slow learners.
Organized tailored reading material from news articles and Korean novles, guiding the student through hands-on activities to digest and apply information.
Relevant award: Volunteer Social Service Award, Jun 2021

volunteer.position: Phase 2 of Project Theatre Together: Let Theatre Grow
volunteer.summary: Theatre Together: Sharing the Joy of Musical Theatre
highlights: Designed an interactive youth program to promote healing and growth through mentee-led rearrangement of ˝Les Misérables.˝

Staged ˝On My Way,˝ an original English performance based on life stories of youth from North Korean backgrounds, in collaboration of St. Paul Preparatory Seoul students and an alternative school for NK youth.
Assisted in character development and music arrangement in the alternative school's theatre adaptation of ˝You Are Special (Max Lucado).˝

volunteer.position: Phase 1 of Project Theatre Together: Let Theatre Bloom
volunteer.summary: Theatre Together: Sharing the Joy of Musical Theatre
highlights: Rearranged ˝Les Misérables˝ with cultural sensitivity for Korean audiences, enriching contextual understanding through tailored subtitles.
Performed in community cultural events in Hoengseong, e.g., nursing home visits and local festivals.

volunteer.position: English-to-Korean Translator for Khan Acdaemy Videos
highlights: Worked 166 hours as a volunteer English-to-Korean translator, writing subtitles for Khan Academy educational videos on biology, chemistry, medicine, and math.
